0 Course Overview

Goal

Learning how to design and implement the software which makes autonomous an autonomous mobile robot (e.g., symbolic planning, trajectory planning, localization, perception, mapping, etc.)

Material

  • Teacher’s slides.
  • ROS http://wiki.ros.org/melodic/Installation
  • Slack group for the project
  • Probabilistic Robotics, Editore: MIT Press, Anno edizione: 2005, ISBN: 978-0262201629 http://www.probabilistic-robotics.org/

Course Evaluation

  • A written examination covering the whole program graded up to 27/32.
  • A home project(can be replaced by a lab project) in simulation practicing the topics of the course graded up to 5/32.(2-3 people)

Lecture1: Introduction

Robot History:

  • Mechanical era (1700): • automata • karakuri-ningyo
  • Fiction era (’20s): • Rossum Universal Robot
  • Cybernetics era (‘40s): • Turtle and telerobot
  • Automation era (from the ‘60s): • Industrial robots
    Robot Categories:
  • Industrial Robot
  • Service Robot
      • personal service robot
      • professional service robot

Standards and definitions
ISO definitions:

  • A robot system is a system comprising robot(s), end-effector(s) and any machinery, equipment, or sensors supporting the robot performing its task.
  • According to the definition, “a degree of autonomy” is required for service robots ranging from partial autonomy (including human robot interaction) to full autonomy (without active human robot intervention).
  • Manipulating industrial robots could also be regarded as service robots, provided they are installed in non-manufacturing operations.
  • In some cases, service robots consist of a mobile platform on which one or several arms are attached and controlled in the same mode as the arms of industrial robot. Furthermore, contrary to their industrial counterparts, service robots do not have to be fully automatic or autonomous. In many cases these machines may even assist a human user or be tele-operated.

What makes an autonomous robot?

  • 1 Sensor -> sense
  • 2 Algorithms ->plan
  • 3 Actuators -> Act

Lecture2: Sensors & Actuators

  • Sensors
  • Proprioceptive sensors
  • Exterocemptive sensors

  • Effectors modify the environment state • Match the robot task (e.g., wheels, legs, grippers)

  • Actuators enable effectors to act • E.g., passive actuation, motors of various types

DC Motors

Direct Current (DC) motors

  • Convert electrical energy into mechanical energy
  • Small, cheap, reasonably efficient, easy to use
    How it works？youtube

Brushed and Brushless Motors

两者优缺点总结：40-43min

Torque in a DC motor

  • Torque
  • Stall torque

Power of a Motor

—- 55分前重听

Motor Efficiency

Motor efficiency $ \eta = $

DC motors are not perfectly efficient
• Due to friction energy is wasted as heat
• Industrial-grade motors (good quality) 90%
• Toy motors (cheap) 50%, Micro-motors for miniature robots < 50%

75分钟左右两个问题

Gearing(传动装置\齿轮)

  • Rotational force generated at the center of a gear is equal to the gear’s radius times the force applied tangential at circumference.
    • Example:

  • Meshing gears:by combining gears with different ratios we can control the amount of force and torque generated.

  • Gearing Effect on Speed

entry.content:
0 Course Overview

Goal

  • The theoretical basics of CG
  • Knowledge of WebgGL,writting some code about interact and non-interact 3D graphics.

Bibliography

  • M. Gribaudo, BEEP
  • Computer Graphics: Principles and Practice in C, Editore: Addison-Wesley Professional, ISBN: 978-0201848403

Course Evaluation

  • several assignments(alone) + a complete project(group:1-3 people,36:00前后)
    • Assignments在Exam期间才需要提交，平时不用交
    • 分数评估取决于project的情况，如果project很好assignmnets不再重要。
  • oral discussion where the project and the assignments + Some theory questions
  • Projects topics and rules will be presented at the middle of the course, when we will have seen sufficient material to start it.

Lecture1 Graphics adapters(图形适配器), colors and 2D drawings

Graphics adapters

  • Vector graphic adapters (ancient history)

  • Raster graphic adapters(光栅)

    • Have a special memory, called Video Memory (VRAM).

  • Accelerated(加速) graphic adapters

    • special types of raster graphic adapters that have much more memory than the one required to store a single screenshot.

Color vision

  1. 颜色与波长

  2. 人眼对颜色的感知

    • cones (sometimes called ρ-red, β-green, γ-blue)
  3. Color reproduction
  4. Color composition
  5. Color range
  6. Color synthesis
  7. Color quantization
  8. Image resolution
  9. Display resolution
  10. Pixel aspect ratio

2D graphics primitives

  1. 2D Graphics Primitives - coordinates system

  2. Pixel coordinates(hardware coordinates)

    • Note that the coordinate system is left-handed, since it has the y-axis in the opposite direction compared to the classical one.

  3. Clipping

  4. Normalized Screen Coordinates   

    • Goal: Applications want to display the same image regardless of the resolution and the size of the screen. They also want to exploit all the features of the display at their best.
    • It’s a Cartesian coordinate system, where x and y values range between two canonical values (generally between -1 and 1, but other standards such as 0 and 1 also exists).

    •  where $(x_n,y_n)$ is Normalized Screen Coordinates, $(x_s,y_s)$ is Pixel Coordinates, $(s_w,s_h)$ is resolution of display device.

    • Example:
      Pixel coordinates(3×3) -> Normalized Screen Coordinates -> Pixel coordinates(5×5)

      $\left( \begin{array}{ccc}
      1 & 2 & 3 \\
      4 & 5 & 6 \\
      7 & 8 & 9
      \end{array}\right)$ ->
      $\left( \begin{array}{ccc}
      1 & 4 & 7 \\
      2 & 5 & 8 \\
      3 & 6 & 9
      \end{array}\right)$ ->$\left( \begin{array}{ccc}
      1 & 0 &2&0 & 3 \\
      0 & 0 &0&0 & 0 \\
      4 & 0 &5&0 & 6 \\
      0 & 0 &0&0 & 0 \\
      7 & 0 &8 &0 & 9
      \end{array}\right)$

    • Notice: we still have problem of image cutting when aspect ratio is different,such as 4:3 ->16:9

  5. Points,Lines,Triangles

  6. Interpolation:
    liner interpolation

    Equally spaced interpolation

Assignment01 Paint by numbers

  • Q1: match the blue house with red lines and correct the code in function draw() of file draw.js.
  • Q2: draw a circle, approximated with a regular polygon of 128 sides.

  • Extra: draw the Yin-Yang symbol
    Solution:

    Press “3” to show Yin-Yang. Press “2” to show circle. Press “1” to show car.

Lecture2 3D coordinates and basic transforms

Homogeneous coordinates (齐次坐标)

where $w$ defines a scale: the units of measure used by the coordinates.

Homogeneous Transformations Matrix (齐次变换矩阵)

where $R$ is used to do the rotation and $d$ is used to do the displacement.

Affine transforms （仿射变换）

The affine transforms are usually grouped in four classes:

  1. Translation

  2. Scaling
    Modifies the size, while maintaining constant its position and its orientation.
    Effects:

  • Enlarge & Shrink(缩小) & Deform(变形)

Can we achieve this by just adjusting the “w” value? Yes,but it will have some problems about subsequent transformations such as doing perspective transformation

  • Mirror

    Mirroring can be obtained by using negative scaling factors.

    Planar mirroring:  Assigning -1 to the scaling factor of the axis perpendicular(垂直) to the plane (x for plane yz: s_x=-1).

    Axial mirroring:   x and z for y-axis: $s_x=-1,s_z=-1$.

    Central mirroring:   $s_x=s_y=s_z=-1$.

  • Flatten(展平)

    A scaling factor of 0 in any direction, flattens the image along that axis. This however makes the transform matrix not invertible(不可逆), a feature that might require special handling.

  1. Rotation

    Varies the orientation of an object, leaving its position and size unchanged.

  • X-axis
  • Y-axis
  • Z-axis
  1. Shear (Take the y-axis as an example)

    As the value of y-axis increases, the object is linearly bent into a direction specified by a vector (in this case defined by two values: hx and hz ).

  • Y-axis

entry.title: Statistics - Learning Path 统计学习路径
entry.content:
0 Prerequisites：Probability and Inferential Statistics

Course: MIT Probabilistic Systems Analysis and Applied Probability(概率分析及应用)

01/03/2020 - 20/03/2020

Bilibili中字课程,not include seminar/tutoria：https://www.bilibili.com/video/av39034423?p=17
Bilibili原版课程,including seminar/tutoria：https://www.bilibili.com/video/av39034423?p=17

1 Applied Statistics 2020.03-2020.06

1.1 Overview

1) 探索多元数据集：描述性统计数据和图形显示。多元样本的几何形状。广义方差。协方差矩阵导出的度量。
Exploring a multivariate dataset: descriptive statistics and graphical displays. The geometry of a multivariate sample. Generalized Variance. The metric induced by the covariance matrix.

2) 数据表示和降维：协方差结构分析，主成分分析。独立成分分析。
Data representation and dimensional reduction: the analysis of the covariance structure, principal component analysis. Independent component analysis.

3) 关于平均向量的推论：$Hotelling T^2$检验。置信区域和分量均值的同时比较。Bonferroni方法可进行多次比较。
Inferences about a mean vector:$Hotelling T^2$test. Confidence regions and simultaneous comparisons of component means. The Bonferroni method for multiple comparisons.
家庭错误率和错误发现率。几种多元均值的比较。方差分析和MANOVA。线性模型的推论。
Familywise Error Rate and False Discovery Rate. Comparisons of several multivariate means. ANOVA and MANOVA. Inference for Linear Models.
超越最小二乘法：岭回归，套索，正则化最小二乘。广义线性模型简介。
Beyond Ordinary Least Squares: ridge regression, lasso, regularized least Squares. Introduction to generalized linear models.

4) 区分，分类，聚类。统计分类：模型，分类错误成本和先验概率。
Discrimination, classification, clustering. Statistical classification: model, misclassification costs and prior probability.
贝叶斯监督分类和Fisher方法进行判别分析。
Bayesian supervised classification and the Fisher approach to discriminant analysis.
分类的替代方法：逻辑回归，CART。相似性度量。无监督分类；分层和非分层方法。多维缩放。
Alternative approaches to classification: logistic regression, CART. Similarity measures. Unsupervised classification; hierarchical and nonhierarchical methods. Multidimensional scaling.

5) 统计学习的进展：功能数据分析。数据平滑，降维和表示。功能主成分分析。数据记录：相位和幅度可变性。功能数据分类。
Advances in Statistical Learning: Functional Data Analysis. Data smoothing, dimensional reduction and representation. Functional principal component analysis. Data registration: phase and amplitude variability. Classification of functional data.

6) 统计学习的进展：空间数据。随机字段，方差图模型和方差图拟合。空间预测和Kriging，具有空间依赖性的功能数据。
Advances in Statistical Learning: spatial data. Random fields, variogram models and variogram fitting. Spatial prediction and Kriging, Functional data with spatial dependence.

2.1 Basic Concept

  • $j$ is accessiable from $i$.
  • $j$ and $i$ communicate.
  • $C$ is a class in $E$ .

  • $i$ is transient : 从$i$出发，有限步数内不一定可以返回$i$.

2.1 Echo Method

回音法介绍https://zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/31760454
1.把整段影片扫过一次
2.熟读文字档
3.仔细听一段话：播放5个字以内的一段话，专心的听。留意发音、语调、重音，并配合文字档听懂意思。
